data.title: A Bit Empty
data.text: We were in the theater district to attend an event at the Tralf. The show was excellent. However as we wandered through the theater district, we saw a lot of venues, however there was very little activity...and this was a Friday night. The theaters did not seem to be advertising events, and may have not been in use. The complete lack of people on the streets seemed odd. I think that the theater district has great potential, bit if being very under-utilized.

data.title: Intimate setting, no bad seats
data.text: Just saw Love Letters this weekend, 5/14 with Ali McGraw and Ryan O'Neal. This was at 710 Main Theater. There are no bad seats in this Theater. Plenty of room between seats. Wide isle for walking and handicap access. You feel so close to the stage that you are almost part of the show. Very clean, too. I will return for other shows.

data.title: Getting there
data.text: Lots of unique theaters and shows. Nice mix of original and restored architecture but still missing a vibe. Local and chain restaurants are to be found in the district along with an art gallery and hostel. Buffalo transit runs right through the heart of the district for easy access.

data.title: ??? District. Well, maybe.
data.text:
Buffalo as long seen its glory days past. What's left of the theater district is a mixed bag. Shea's is great. The other smaller theaters are less significant and much less interesting. Unfortunately the street is marred by a horrible light rail that goes smack dab down the center.

Some reasonable restaurants close to Sheas

Parking is usually a hassle. In the winter it's a very unpleasant street to walk.

Never struck me as a very safe place to be.

data.title: Lots of rebuilds
data.text:
There is lots of rebuilds and renovations on this street. Makes it a bit difficult to walk around because some parts of the sidewalks are closed.

Apart from that it's lots of theaters, shops and restaurants to choose from.

In the end of the district (or beginning depends on how you see it) there is a big sign saying "Buffalo Theatre District". In front of the sign some flowers are growing which I thought looked nice.

data.title: what district?
data.text: really, despite all the intentions to re-invent the wheel, the thought of this as a "district" is a joke, like shea's and the seven dwarfs... and then they take the rapid-transit stop out? ... how many times can buffalo shoot itself in the food? are we a centipede?

data.title: Exciting and fun district
data.text: Always something to do here. Live theater, movie theater, shopping and dinning and the best part is the renovations; re-opening of Main St. for the first time in over 30 years cars will share the street with the metro rail come Spring 2014. Every building on the block is now cleaned up with new businesses moving in! When in the area, be sure to stop inside the Market Arcade at 617 Main St. (Buffalo's first shopping mall built in 1892) for cool retails such as J. Christian Fashion Boutique, Sasmita Batik Indonesia, Queen City Gallery, Buffalo Visitor Center and CEPA Gallery.

data.title: Unique
data.text: What a selection of theatres we have here in Buffalo ;  Plays, Musicals -  love the walkability and surrounding access to parking

data.title: Great to explore!
data.text:
Rating four stars for the theatres - not for much else. There could be more restaurants down here, but it is a nice place to visit. Besides the theatres that were mentioned, there is TGI Fridays and a few other restaurants that are open @ night. There is also the Tralf, which hosts comedy and music shows. That is next to Shea's. 

If you're here during the day, there is Sue's NY Deli (same building as Tralf) and the visitor's center (brochures & gift shop) that is across the street from Sheas. Other than that, I agree with Robthorold - you need to go to Chippewa for more to do.

data.title: Where the Thespians hang out !
data.text: The main attraction here is Shea's on Main Street. It has been renovated over the last couple of years by an army of volunteers. When entering the theater you will be overwhelmed by the feeling of stepping back to another place in time ! This venue attracts all of the popular major tours from around the country. Also in the same block you will find several small theaters featuring all types of shows mostly with local performers. Hopefully the former Studio Arena Theater will soon be finished and added back into the top venues in this area.

data.title: Great area
data.text: My wife loves stage shows. if you like that then somewhere here you'll find something of interest. the local bars are fun places. worth the visit.

data.title: Molto americana!!!
data.text: Bella città molto vicina alla Niagara Falls,grandi palazzi e molte chiese,ho visto in centro il tram vecchio stile,molto affascinante...,se vai alle Niagara Falls vale la pena visitarla
